elements.title: TD-2 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Bell Labs' TD-2 microwave-relay system (tower pictured) was used to carry television signals and telephone calls across North America?

elements.title: Hans Drewanz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when conductor Hans Drewanz, a personal assistant to Georg Solti at the Oper Frankfurt, became Generalmusikdirektor in Darmstadt, he was the youngest GMD in Germany?

elements.title: tenth studio album X (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that music producer Mylo briefly posted two of his rejected tracks for Kylie Minogue's tenth studio album X online, before the album release?

elements.title: Cornelia Chase Brant (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Cornelia Chase Brant was one of the first women to be appointed to the staff of a public hospital in New York City?

elements.title: scarlet-and-white tanager (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the scarlet-and-white tanager swallows small berries whole, but eats larger fruit piece by piece?

elements.title: OpenAI Codex (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that OpenAI Codex's use of licensed code as training data has raised questions about the copyright status of machine learning models?

elements.title: Lotte Bailyn (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that social psychologist Lotte Bailyn, the first woman faculty member at the MIT Sloan School of Management, is an expert in work and family dynamics?

elements.title: Chaconne in G minor (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that some music scholars have suggested that the Chaconne in G minor, widely attributed to Tomaso Antonio Vitali, is a musical hoax?
